title: Women's Rights National Historical Park: Visitor Center
body: Visitor Center         Visitor Center, 136 Fall Street, Seneca Falls. NPS/Patrick Stenshorn  Begin your visit to Women's Rights National Historical Park in the visitor center. View an introductory film "Dreams of Equality" in the Guntzel Theater. Explore our permanent exhibit gallery on the second floor. Meet the organizers of the convention face to face at the First Wave statue exhibit. Rangers and park staff may assist you with planning your visit, brochures, tour times, schedules, directions, and maps. Restrooms are located off the first floor lobby. The visitor center is accessible to wheelchair users. Adjacent to the visitor center is Declaration Park with outdoor seating, the Waterwall, and the Wesleyan Chapel.                       Women's Rights NHP Visitor Center   11 Photos  View a portion of the visitor center lobby and second floor exhibits.
